spent/wasted countless hours of my life watching videos of our government's 
abuse of power, and it still outrages me as much as the first video I 
viewed. 

With that said, I feel compelled to point out what appears to me as a bit 
of hypocrisy. I watched this video showing the group of guys challenging 
border patrol agents who asked if they are American citizens. After this 
video ended it then redirected me to another one of your videos where 
you're complaining (rightfully so, in my opinion) that our government isn't 
doing enough to halt the influx of illegals. At that moment, it kit me; how 
can we complain when they're checking us out to determine of we are in fact 
Americans, but then turn around and complain that they aren't doing enough 
to capture those here illegally. Aren't we expecting to have it both ways?

agents for their constant violation of the obligation to have "reasonable

that choose to not answer their inane questions.

by these ill-trained and idiotic border agents. This code only allows for

answer a question.

the Constitution than the 'Bill of Rights'. Article 3 of the Constitution 
grants the United States Supreme Court the authority to determine the 
Constitutionality of disputes brought before it. The question of the 
Constitutionality of these border patrols was brought before the Supreme 
Court and, in accordance the authority granted to the Court by Article 3 of 
the U.S. Constitution, they ruled them to be both legal and within the 
Constitutional limits (as long as they are within the 'border area' which 
is defined as 100 miles from the border or point of entry). You may not
